result.execSummary:
All charges against Philip S. Dobbertin in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Philip S. Dobbertin is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called @ 3:06 PM Defendant Philip S. Dobbertin in court.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Philip S. Dobbertin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. NGP entered as to both matters. The competency issue had been previously raised. Atty Rae advises that her client is no longer contesting competency. The Court finds that the defendant is competent to proceed.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.

Case called @ 2:02 PM Defendant Philip S. Dobbertin in court.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court has concerns about the defendant's competency to proceed. ADA Kottke also joins in the concerns. The Court sua sponte orders a 971.14 evaluation. Advised of right of Counsel- defendant referred to SPD. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
